result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on December 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

10:36 AM Defendant Ronald T Long in court.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Ronald T Long.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Warrant was signed but never forwarded to DCSO.

Defendant appeared at 4:00; DA's office agrees to not issue warrant and reissue date for Status Conference.  Defendant provided new address.
2:50 PM Defendant Ronald T Long not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Thomas B. 
- Defendant shall not be at 816 County Hwy N. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:47 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
